intro: Malachra fasciata var. lineariloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf malachra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
